resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on pull request #5302: ARROW-6435: [Python] Use pandas null coding consistently on List and Struct types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5302#discussion_r321527551
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/python_to_arrow.cc
 ##########
 @@ -607,8 +607,26 @@ class StringConverter
 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 // Convert lists (NumPy arrays containing lists or ndarrays as values)
 
-template <typename TypeClass>
-class ListConverter : public TypedConverter<TypeClass, ListConverter<TypeClass>> {
+// If the value type does not match the expected NumPy dtype, then fall through
+// to a slower PySequence-based path
+#define LIST_FAST_CASE(TYPE, NUMPY_TYPE, ArrowType)               \
+  case Type::TYPE: {                                              \
+    if (PyArray_DESCR(arr)->type_num != NUMPY_TYPE) {             \
+      return value_converter_->AppendMultiple(obj, value_length); \
+    }                                                             \
+    return AppendNdarrayTypedItem<NUMPY_TYPE, ArrowType>(arr);    \
+  }
+
+// Use internal::VisitSequence, fast for NPY_OBJECT but slower otherwise
+#define LIST_SLOW_CASE(TYPE)                                    \
+  case Type::TYPE: {                                            \
+    return value_converter_->AppendMultiple(obj, value_length); \
+  }
 
 Review comment:
   Moved code

   template <int NUMPY_TYPE, typename Type>

wesm commented on pull request #5302: ARROW-6435: [Python] Use pandas null coding consistently on List and Struct types
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5302#discussion_r321527566
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/python/python_to_arrow.cc
 ##########
 @@ -607,8 +607,26 @@ class StringConverter
 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 // Convert lists (NumPy arrays containing lists or ndarrays as values)
 
-template <typename TypeClass>
-class ListConverter : public TypedConverter<TypeClass, ListConverter<TypeClass>> {
+// If the value type does not match the expected NumPy dtype, then fall through
+// to a slower PySequence-based path
+#define LIST_FAST_CASE(TYPE, NUMPY_TYPE, ArrowType)               \
+  case Type::TYPE: {                                              \
+    if (PyArray_DESCR(arr)->type_num != NUMPY_TYPE) {             \
+      return value_converter_->AppendMultiple(obj, value_length); \
+    }                                                             \
+    return AppendNdarrayTypedItem<NUMPY_TYPE, ArrowType>(arr);    \
+  }
+
+// Use internal::VisitSequence, fast for NPY_OBJECT but slower otherwise
+#define LIST_SLOW_CASE(TYPE)                                    \
+  case Type::TYPE: {                                            \
+    return value_converter_->AppendMultiple(obj, value_length); \
+  }
+
+template <typename TypeClass, NullCoding null_coding>
+class ListConverter
+    : public TypedConverter<TypeClass, ListConverter<TypeClass, null_coding>,
+                            null_coding> {
 
 Review comment:
   Relevant changes

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: See https://circleci.com/gh/ursa-labs/crossbow/2326. Either fix, skip job and create followup Jira to unskip, or delete job.

comments.body:
Ben shared the reproducer with me. Neither of these failure modes here is great

{code}
In [1]: s = pd.Series([np.nan, np.nan]) 

In [10]: pa.array(s, type=pa.list_(pa.int64()), from_pandas=True, safe=True)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ArrowNotImplementedError                  Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-10-1e7ed1b785ed> in <module>
----> 1 pa.array(s, type=pa.list_(pa.int64()), from_pandas=True, safe=True)

~/code/arrow/python/pyarrow/array.pxi in pyarrow.lib.array()
    205                 values, type = pandas_api.compat.get_datetimetz_type(
    206                     values, obj.dtype, type)
--> 207             return _ndarray_to_array(values, mask, type, c_from_pandas, safe,
    208                                      pool)
    209     else:

~/code/arrow/python/pyarrow/array.pxi in pyarrow.lib._ndarray_to_array()
     76
     77     with nogil:
---> 78         check_status(NdarrayToArrow(pool, values, mask, from_pandas,
     79                                     c_type, cast_options, &chunked_out))
     80

~/code/arrow/python/pyarrow/error.pxi in pyarrow.lib.check_status()
     84             raise ArrowKeyError(message)
     85         elif status.IsNotImplemented():
---> 86             raise ArrowNotImplementedError(message)
     87         elif status.IsTypeError():
     88             raise ArrowTypeError(message)

ArrowNotImplementedError: NumPyConverter doesn't implement <list<item: int64>> conversion.
In ../src/arrow/python/numpy_to_arrow.cc, line 821, code: converter.Convert()

In [11]: s = pd.Series([np.nan, np.nan], dtype=object)

In [12]: s
Out[12]:
0    NaN
1    NaN
dtype: object

In [13]: pa.array(s, type=pa.list_(pa.int64()), from_pandas=True, safe=True)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-13-1e7ed1b785ed> in <module>
----> 1 pa.array(s, type=pa.list_(pa.int64()), from_pandas=True, safe=True)

~/code/arrow/python/pyarrow/array.pxi in pyarrow.lib.array()
    205                 values, type = pandas_api.compat.get_datetimetz_type(
    206                     values, obj.dtype, type)
--> 207             return _ndarray_to_array(values, mask, type, c_from_pandas, safe,
    208                                      pool)
    209     else:

~/code/arrow/python/pyarrow/array.pxi in pyarrow.lib._ndarray_to_array()
     76
     77     with nogil:
---> 78         check_status(NdarrayToArrow(pool, values, mask, from_pandas,
     79                                     c_type, cast_options, &chunked_out))
     80

TypeError: object of type 'float' has no len()
{code}

I'm going to take a look
These are working again, I guess the failure I saw hadn't gotten the fix in dask master yet
